qas.question: On estimate how many megatonnes of pesticides were used between 2006 and 2007?
What amount of conventional pesticide use does the agricultural sector account for?
Pesticides contain at least how many ingredients?
How maney pesticides are offered for sale in the US?
How many pesticide products are sold worldwide?
How many active ingredients were in herbicides used in agriculture in 2006?
What percentage of pesticides in the US are sold at home and garden centers?
How many pounds of pesticide are used by the US government?
How much of conventional pesticide use is by the US government?

context: In 2006 and 2007, the world used <a0_0>approximately 2.4<a0_0/> megatonnes (5.3×109 lb) of pesticides, with herbicides constituting the biggest part of the world pesticide use at 40%, followed by insecticides (17%) and fungicides (10%). In 2006 and 2007 the U.S. used approximately 0.5 megatonnes (1.1×109 lb) of pesticides, accounting for <b6_0>22%<b6_0/> of the world total, including <b7_0>857 million<b7_0/> pounds (389 kt) of conventional pesticides, which are used in the agricultural sector (<a1_0><b8_0>80%<b8_0/><a1_0/> of conventional pesticide use) as well as the industrial, commercial, governmental and home & garden sectors.Pesticides are also found in majority of U.S. households with 78 million out of the 105.5 million households indicating that they use some form of pesticide. As of 2007, there were <a2_0><b5_0>more than 1,055<b5_0/><a2_0/> active ingredients registered as pesticides, which yield <a3_0><b4_0>over 20,000<b4_0/><a3_0/> pesticide products that are marketed in the United States.
